items.title: Victoria's bushfire crisis turns deadly as conditions ease
items.description: Emergency services discovered the body of a person in Central Victoria on Sunday afternoon. The fatal turn comes as firefighters use favourable conditions to contain more than 20 blazes across the state.

items.title: Live: Fight to contain deadly Victorian blazes rages on with 300 buildings lost
items.description: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 390,000 hectares burnt. Follow live.

items.title: 'This was a safe place': Harcourt's heart in ruins but community stands strong
items.description: In a region famed for its lush pastoral farmland, locals thought Harcourt was less likely to be hit than neighbouring bush towns Castlemaine and Barkers Creek.

items.title: 'These ICE agents are here for sport': Why Minneapolis was targeted
items.description: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.

items.title: A Taliban leader sat before me while millions of women remained unseen
items.description: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

items.title: Why there are no Michelin-starred restaurants in Australia
items.description: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

items.title: Waltzing Matilda tribute for youngest victim of the Bondi shooting
items.description: More than 2,000 people attended a vigil for the Bondi shooting victim at the Bondi Pavilion, marking the end of the Jewish period of mourning.

items.title: At least 500 killed in Iran protests as Trump weighs up intervention
items.description: The US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency says a further 10,600 people have been arrested as Iran's theocratic government attempts to crack down on the demonstrations.

items.title: Can't shake intrusive thoughts? It might be a sign of OCD
items.description: Everyone experiences intrusive thoughts, and most people can brush them off without a worry. But what happens when those intrusive thoughts become inescapable?

items.title: Ozempic-like drug to be listed on PBS for people with severe obesity
items.description: The cost of weight loss drug Wegovy will soon be massively subsidised for Australians with severe obesity who have had a stroke or heart attack.

items.title: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants
items.description: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities who want to protect their suburb's identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

items.title: Tasmania to expand fire detection tech after AI cameras spot 550 blazes
items.description: As fire crews were responding to two fires on Tasmania's east coast in December, an AI camera nestled in a nearby vantage point spotted a third blaze. The early detection meant the fire was extinguished just two hours later.

items.title: Strength is Sabalenka's superpower, but variety will win her the AO
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka has won yet another title on Australian soil, showing that the Australian Open is hers for the taking.

items.title: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths
items.description: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

items.title: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal' as US cuts off Venezuelan oil
items.description: The US is enforcing a strict oil blockade on Venezuela, the communist country's main supplier of oil, as the Trump administration continues to push Latin American countries to align with it.

items.title: Taxpayers could foot $100k bill for assault-accused MP's re-election bid
items.description: Independent MP Nick McBride, who is currently on home detention bail for the alleged assault of his wife, could receive around $100,000 in public funding to support his re-election campaign, according to the state's electoral commission.

items.title: Labor MPs apologise over 'shoot, shag or marry' game at public festival
items.description: A federal assistant minister and two Tasmanian state Labor MPs apologise after a complaint was made about their behaviour at the Taste of Summer festival in Hobart.

items.title: Intense rainfall follows ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji in sodden north Queensland
items.description: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji has crossed the north Queensland coast between the towns of Ayr and Bowen and has weakened into a tropical low pressure system.

items.title: History quiz: An EGOT, a giant toad and Sylvia Plath
items.description: Holy giant toads, Batman! Will you ace this week's look back at the past?

items.title: Adelaide Festival board members, chair quit after author's cancellation from Writers' Week
items.description: The Adelaide Festival board's decision to cancel the appearance of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah from this year's Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted further fallout, with several board members and the chair stepping down.

items.title: Muslim leader and wife allegedly abused, assaulted in Melbourne
items.description: Police are investigating reports of an Islamic community leader being assaulted after he and his wife were forced off the road by a vehicle and racially abused in Dandenong South.

items.title: Former UK diplomat says he did not know about Epstein abuse
items.description: Peter Mandelson, who was fired as the UK's ambassador in Washington DC over his ties to the convicted sex offender, has apologised to victims of Jeffrey Epstein "for a system that refused to hear their voices".

items.title: Relaxed Medvedev claims Brisbane International crown
items.description: Daniil Medvedev enjoys Australian Open warm up with first Brisbane International crown.

items.title: Frosty finish as ice-cold Sabalenka soars to second-successive Brisbane title
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka has claimed her second-straight Brisbane International title, beating Marta Kostyuk 6-4, 6-3.

items.title: Farm kids gifted champion's puppies to secure a skilled future
items.description: In small towns scattered around Australia, five kids have hit the jackpot. They've each been given a puppy from a champion muster dog.
